security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing no executable code. All 17 static findings are false positives: the scanner misidentified markdown code fences as shell commands, flagged common words like 'share' and 'slack' as cryptographic terms, and misinterpreted repository metadata as network security issues. The skill describes a workflow for creating and sharing Claude skills via Slack integration.

content.user_title: Create and Share Claude Skills with Your Team
content.value_statement: Teams struggle to share and discover Claude skills across members. This skill automates skill creation and notifies your team via Slack when new skills are ready. It ensures consistent structure and enables seamless collaboration on custom AI capabilities.
actual_capabilities: Creates properly structured skill directories with SKILL.md templates
Generates scripts/, references/, and assets/ directories automatically
Validates skill format, naming conventions, and metadata completeness
Packages skills into distributable zip files for sharing
Posts skill announcements to Slack channels via Rube integration
limitations: Requires Slack workspace connection through Rube
Only creates skill structure, not functional code
Needs write access to the skill creation directory

use_cases.title: Standardize skill creation
use_cases.description: Ensure all team-created skills follow consistent structure and metadata standards for easier maintenance

use_cases.title: Manage skill distribution
use_cases.description: Automate skill packaging and team notifications for better skill discovery across your organization

use_cases.title: Share custom skills
use_cases.description: Build specialized Claude skills and share them with immediate visibility through team Slack channels

output: Created scripts/, references/, and assets/ folders
Posted to Slack: 'New Skill Available: email-classifier - Automatically categorize support emails by urgency and department'

output_examples.input: Create a documentation helper skill and share it
output: Validated YAML frontmatter and required fields

best_practices: Use descriptive skill names that clearly indicate the primary function
Include comprehensive descriptions in SKILL.md for better team understanding
Choose appropriate Slack channels for skill announcements based on team structure
anti_patterns: Creating overly broad skills that try to do too many things at once
Sharing skills without proper documentation or usage examples
Ignoring naming conventions which breaks consistency across the skill library

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude versions?
faq.answer: Yes, it creates standard skill structures compatible with Claude and Claude Code platforms

faq.question: What are the limits on skill creation?
faq.answer: No hard limits exist, but follow naming conventions and keep descriptions concise and clear

faq.question: Can I integrate with platforms besides Slack?
faq.answer: Currently only supports Slack via Rube, but the skill structure is platform-agnostic

faq.question: Is my data safe when sharing skills?
faq.answer: Yes, only skill metadata is shared to Slack, not your actual data or usage information

faq.question: Skills are not posting to Slack, what should I check?
faq.answer: Verify your Rube connection is active and the target Slack channel exists and is accessible

faq.question: How does this compare to manual skill creation?
faq.answer: It enforces consistency, validates structure automatically, and removes manual team notification steps
